what: How to create a PX-file from a data set
title: First PX-file
text: workflows pxmake, starts way: using px() create px object. using built dataset population_gl. create px object, simply pass data set px() function. x now px object. word object just means PX-file stored specific format functions pxmake package uses. Use px_save() save px object PX-file. Since provided metadata, px() added minimal set metadata, necessary creating valid PX-file. resulting PX-file can seen .
code: library(pxmake)  population_gl |>   head(10) |>   print() #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    gender age   year      n #>    <fct>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 male   0-6   2004   3237 #>  2 male   0-6   2014   2950 #>  3 male   0-6   2024   2769 #>  4 male   7-16  2004   5085 #>  5 male   7-16  2014   4040 #>  6 male   7-16  2024   3865 #>  7 male   17-24 2004   3191 #>  8 male   17-24 2014   3614 #>  9 male   17-24 2024   2940 #> 10 male   25-64 2004  17328 x <- px(population_gl) px_save(x, "population_gl.px") CHARSET="ANSI"; DECIMALS=0; MATRIX="matrix"; SUBJECT-CODE="subject-code"; SUBJECT-AREA="subject-area"; TITLE=""; CONTENTS="contents"; STUB="gender","age"; HEADING="year"; VALUES("gender")="female","male"; VALUES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; VALUES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; UNITS="units"; CODES("gender")="female","male"; CODES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; CODES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; VARIABLECODE("gender")="gender"; VARIABLECODE("age")="age"; VARIABLECODE("year")="year"; VARIABLECODE("n")="n"; DATA= 3109 2644 2668 3003 3528 2862 13744 14397 15098 1630 2004 2616 5018 3979 3534 3237 2950 2769 3191 3614 2940 17328 16888 17231 1481 2238 3116 5085 4040 3865 ;

what: How to create a PX-file from a PX-file
title: First PX-file
text: already PX-file, want manipulate using pxmake, simple pass path file, px() function. Just dataset, x2 now px object can saved modified using functions pxmake.
code: x2 <- px("population_gl.px")

title: First PX-file
text: real fun starts start modifying px object, using one pxmake many built functions. general, px keyword corresponding function pxmake. example, change title PX-file, can use px_title() function. px_title() function returns new px object, title changed. original px object modified. resulting PX-file can seen .
code: x3 <- px_title(x, "Population in Greenland") x3 |>   px_codepage("UTF-8") |> # Change file encoding     px_matrix("pop") |>   px_contact("Johan Ejstrud") |>   px_subject_code("GL") |>   px_subject_area("Greenland") |>   px_timeval("year") |>   px_contents("Population in Greenland") |>   px_units("People") |>   px_note("See information about data: ?population_gl") |>   px_last_updated(format(Sys.time(), "%Y%m%d %H:%M")) |>   px_stub(c("age", "gender")) |> # Change order of STUB variables   px_save("population_gl_modified.px") CHARSET="ANSI"; CODEPAGE="UTF-8"; DECIMALS=0; MATRIX="pop"; SUBJECT-CODE="GL"; SUBJECT-AREA="Greenland"; TITLE="Population in Greenland"; CONTENTS="Population in Greenland"; STUB="age","gender"; HEADING="year"; VALUES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; VALUES("gender")="female","male"; VALUES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; UNITS="People"; TIMEVAL("year")=TLIST(A1),"2004","2014","2024"; CODES("age")="0-6","17-24","25-64","65+","7-16"; CODES("gender")="female","male"; CODES("year")="2004","2014","2024"; VARIABLECODE("age")="age"; VARIABLECODE("gender")="gender"; VARIABLECODE("year")="year"; VARIABLECODE("n")="n"; LAST-UPDATED="20250407 12:36"; CONTACT="Johan Ejstrud"; NOTE="See information about data: ?population_gl"; DATA= 3109 2644 2668 3237 2950 2769 3003 3528 2862 3191 3614 2940 13744 14397 15098 17328 16888 17231 1630 2004 2616 1481 2238 3116 5018 3979 3534 5085 4040 3865 ;

title: First PX-file
text: See vignettes advanced use cases: - vignette("languages") - vignette("micro-files")

title: Micro files
text: px_micro() exists support specific use case Statistics Greenland. use create small PX-files showcase present metadata lager data set made publicly available. See example Statistic Greenland’s microdata Research Analysis.

title: Micro files
text: Apart px_save(), px_micro() function can save px objects PX-files. px_micro() turns px object many smaller PX-files, containing subset variables original px object.

title: Micro files
text: basis micro files usually data set doesn’t count variable (like PX-files). px_micro() instead create count individual variable. example use built-data data set greenlanders.
code: library(pxmake)  greenlanders |> dplyr::sample_n(10) |> dplyr::arrange_all() #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    cohort gender   age municipality #>    <chr>  <chr>  <int> <chr>        #>  1 A      female    21 Sermersooq   #>  2 A      female    59 Qeqertalik   #>  3 A      male      24 Kujalleq     #>  4 A      male      48 Qeqqata      #>  5 A      male      63 Avannaata    #>  6 B      female    32 Kujalleq     #>  7 B      female    73 Avannaata    #>  8 B      male      44 Qeqertalik   #>  9 B      male      62 Sermersooq   #> 10 B      male      98 Qeqertalik

title: Micro files
text: Create px object px(), pass px_micro(). folder now contains three PX-files, one variable except ‘age’. reason ‘age’ didn’t get PX-file HEADING variable x, px_micro() creates file non-HEADING variable. Instead HEADNING variable used created PX-files. case, want ‘cohort’ heading, create PX-file ‘gender’, ‘age’ ‘municipality’. folder now contains files wanted. file contains one three variables STUB, ‘cohort’ HEADING, variable ‘n’ count combination variables.
code: # Create px object x <- px(greenlanders)  # Create folder for micro files micro_dir <- file.path("micro_files") dir.create(micro_dir)  # Write micro files to folder px_micro(x, out_dir = micro_dir) list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "cohort.px"       "gender.px"       "municipality.px" # Print HEADING variables px_heading(x) #> [1] "age"  # Print non-HEADING variables c(px_stub(x), px_figures(x)) #> [1] "cohort"       "gender"       "municipality" x2 <-   x |>   px_stub('age') |>    # Change age to STUB   px_heading('cohort') # Change cohort to HEADING # Clear folder unlink(file.path(micro_dir, "*.px"))  px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir) list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "age.px"          "gender.px"       "municipality.px" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'age.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 120 × 3 #>    age   cohort     n #>    <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1 18    A         NA #>  2 18    B          1 #>  3 19    A         NA #>  4 19    B          1 #>  5 20    A         NA #>  6 20    B          1 #>  7 21    A          3 #>  8 21    B         NA #>  9 22    A          1 #> 10 22    B         NA #> # ℹ 110 more rows  px(file.path(micro_dir, 'gender.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   gender cohort     n #>   <chr>  <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 female A         31 #> 2 female B         18 #> 3 male   A         23 #> 4 male   B         28  px(file.path(micro_dir, 'municipality.px'))$data #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    municipality cohort     n #>    <chr>        <chr>  <dbl> #>  1 Avannaata    A         11 #>  2 Avannaata    B         11 #>  3 Kujalleq     A         12 #>  4 Kujalleq     B          7 #>  5 Qeqertalik   A         13 #>  6 Qeqertalik   B          5 #>  7 Qeqqata      A          9 #>  8 Qeqqata      B         11 #>  9 Sermersooq   A          9 #> 10 Sermersooq   B         12

title: Micro files
text: general keyword values px object carried micro files. case keywords like ‘MATRIX’, ‘SUBJECT-CODE’, ‘CONTACT’, ‘LANGUAGE’, ‘CODEPAGE’, etc. change keywords across micro files, easiest change px object calling px_micro(). However, keywords need changed individually micro file. , create data frame column ‘variable’ column px keyword change. Supply dataframe keyword_values argument px_micro(). DESCRIPTION changed micro files:
code: # Change CONTACT in all micro files x2 |>   px_contact("Johan Ejstrud") |>   px_micro(out_dir = micro_dir) individual_keywords <- tibble::tribble(~variable     ,      ~px_description,                                        "age"         ,    "Age count 18-99",                                        "gender"      ,       "Gender count",                                        "municipality",  "Municipality 2024"                                        ) px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords) px(file.path(micro_dir, 'age.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Age count 18-99" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'gender.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Gender count" px(file.path(micro_dir, 'municipality.px')) %>% px_description() #> [1] "Municipality 2024"

title: Micro files
text: multilingual files add ‘language’ column keyword_values. ‘px_description’ varies language, ‘px_matrix’ set one languages, since language dependent keywords. language independant keywords doesn’t matter language value set .
code: x3 <-   x2 |>   px_language("en") |>   px_languages(c("en", "kl"))   individual_keywords_ml <-    tibble::tribble(        ~variable, ~language,     ~px_description, ~px_matrix,            "age",      "en",   "Age count 18-99",      "AGE",            "age",      "kl",       "Ukiut 18-99",         NA,         "gender",      "en",      "Gender count",      "GEN",         "gender",      "kl",      " Suiaassuseq",         NA,   "municipality",      "en", "Municipality 2024",      "MUN",   "municipality",      "kl",      "Kommuni 2024",         NA   )  px_micro(x3, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords_ml)

title: Micro files
text: filenames micro files default name variable, however can also changed passing ‘filename’ column ‘keyword_values’
code: individual_keywords2 <-    individual_keywords |>   dplyr::mutate(filename = paste0(variable, "_2024", ".px"))  # Clear folder unlink(file.path(micro_dir, "*.px"))  px_micro(x2, out_dir = micro_dir, keyword_values = individual_keywords2)  list.files(micro_dir) #> [1] "age_2024.px"          "gender_2024.px"       "municipality_2024.px"

title: Make PX-Files in R
text: ‘pxmake’ R package creating modifying PX-files. pxmake can: Import PX-file, modify , save new PX-file. Modify metadata keywords PX-file. complex modifications PX-file, like adding total levels variable. Save PX-file Excel workbook.

title: Make PX-Files in R
code: # Install the latest release from CRAN install.packages('pxmake')  # Or the development version from GitHub # install.packages('pak') pak::pak("StatisticsGreenland/pxmake")

title: Make PX-Files in R
text: (Find complete documentation pxmake webpage.) Use px() import existing PX-file R. imported, use one pxmake’s modifying functions. general, modifying functions named keyword modify. ’s possible chain multiple modifying functions together tidyverse style using pipe operator %>%.
code: library(pxmake)  # Import PX-file x <- px(input = "example.px") library(magrittr) # import pipe  # Create px object from data frame x <- px(data.frame(year = as.character(rep(2021:2023, each = 3)),                     group = c('a', 'b', 'c'),                     value = runif(9)                    )         )   head(x$data, 4) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   year  group value #>   <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 2021  a     0.266 #> 2 2021  b     0.372 #> 3 2021  c     0.573 #> 4 2022  a     0.908  x %>%    px_timeval("year") %>%  # Set year as TIMEVAL   px_heading("year") %>%  # Set year as HEADING   px_stub("group") %>%    # Set group as STUB   px_decimals("2") %>%    # Set DECIMALS to 2   px_save("example.px") # Save as PX-file

code: # Create px object from dataset x1 <- px(population_gl)  # Download PX-file for example download_succeeded <- tryCatch({   px_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".px")   url <- "https://bank.stat.gl:443/sq/0cf06962-19f1-4d5c-8d43-b7ed0009617d"   download.file(url, px_path)   TRUE }, error = function(e) FALSE)  # Run examples only if file was downloaded if (download_succeeded) {   # Create px object from PX-file   x2 <- px(px_path)    # Create px object from URL   x3 <- px(url) }  # Create minimal px object x4 <- px()

title: Add total levels to variables — px_add_totals
Add total levels to variables — px_add_totals
code: # Create small px object example x0 <- px(subset(population_gl, age == "65+")) x0$data #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 2 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 3 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 4 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 5 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 6 female 65+   2024   2616  # Add total level to one variable x1 <- px_add_totals(x0, "gender") x1$data #> # A tibble: 9 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Total  65+   2004   3111 #> 2 Total  65+   2014   4242 #> 3 Total  65+   2024   5732 #> 4 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 5 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 6 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 7 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 8 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 9 female 65+   2024   2616  # Add total level to multiple variables x2 <- px_add_totals(x0, c("gender", "age")) x2$data #> # A tibble: 18 × 4 #>    gender age   year      n #>    <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 Total  Total 2004   3111 #>  2 Total  Total 2014   4242 #>  3 Total  Total 2024   5732 #>  4 female Total 2004   1630 #>  5 female Total 2014   2004 #>  6 female Total 2024   2616 #>  7 male   Total 2004   1481 #>  8 male   Total 2014   2238 #>  9 male   Total 2024   3116 #> 10 Total  65+   2004   3111 #> 11 Total  65+   2014   4242 #> 12 Total  65+   2024   5732 #> 13 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 14 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 15 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 16 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 17 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 18 female 65+   2024   2616  # The name of the total level can be changed with px_elimination() x3 <-   x0 |>   px_elimination("T") |>   px_add_totals("gender")  x3$data #> # A tibble: 9 × 4 #>   gender age   year      n #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <dbl> #> 1 T      65+   2004   3111 #> 2 T      65+   2014   4242 #> 3 T      65+   2024   5732 #> 4 male   65+   2004   1481 #> 5 male   65+   2014   2238 #> 6 male   65+   2024   3116 #> 7 female 65+   2004   1630 #> 8 female 65+   2014   2004 #> 9 female 65+   2024   2616

title: CELLNOTE — px_cellnote
code: # Set CELLNOTE for a value library(tibble) x1 <-   population_gl |>   px() |>   px_cellnote(     tribble(~gender,  ~age,  ~year, ~cellnote,              'male', '0-6', '2004', 'Approximation'))  x2 <-   x1 |>   px_cellnote(     tribble(~gender,   ~age,  ~year, ~cellnote,            'female',    '*', '2014', 'Uncertainty in ages'))  # Print CELLNOTE px_cellnote(x2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   gender age   year  cellnote            #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>               #> 1 male   0-6   2004  Approximation       #> 2 female *     2014  Uncertainty in ages  # Set CELLNOTE in multiple languagese x3 <-   x1 |>   px_languages(c('en', 'kl')) |>   px_cellnote(     tribble(~age, ~year, ~language, ~cellnote,              '*', '2003',  'en', 'Some of the figures are from 2003',              '*', '2003', 'kl', 'Kisitsisit ilaat 2003-imeersuupput')) px_cellnote(x3) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   gender age   year  language cellnote                           #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>    <chr>                              #> 1 male   0-6   2004  en       Approximation                      #> 2 male   0-6   2004  kl       Approximation                      #> 3 *      *     2003  en       Some of the figures are from 2003  #> 4 *      *     2003  kl       Kisitsisit ilaat 2003-imeersuupput  # Remove CELLNOTE x4 <- px_cellnote(x3, NULL) px_cellnote(x4) #> NULL

Path values set (.vs) file. agg_paths Optional. NULL, aggregation paths automatically taken [Aggreg] field .vs file. Use vector paths one aggregation files (.agg) manually choose aggregations. Use character(0) aggregations .vs files added automatically.

title: Create a classification object — px_classification
text: classification combination value set zero, one, aggregations. classification can saved .vs .agg files (see px_save_classification()). classification created data frame, arguments name prestext domain required. classification created .vs .agg files, arguments empty. aggregations, normally possible codes values .agg file sections '[Aggreg]' '[Aggtext]' respectively. However, pxmake's implementation classifications, possible distinguish . new classification created, values section '[Aggtext]' used aggregation values. value sets type 'V' supported. Type values sets type 'H' 'N' supported.

title: Create a classification object — px_classification
code: # Create classification from data frame library(tibble)  c1 <- px_classification(name = "Age5",                         prestext = "Ages 0-9 - 60+",                         domain = "age",                         df = tribble(                            ~valuecode,    ~valuetext,   ~`25 years classes`,                                 "0-4",     "0-4 years",              "0-24",                                 "5-9",     "5-9 years",              "0-24",                               "10-14",   "10-14 years",              "0-24",                               "15-19",   "15-19 years",              "0-24",                               "20-24",   "20-24 years",              "0-24",                               "25-29",   "25-29 years",             "25-49",                               "30-34",   "30-34 years",             "25-49",                               "35-39",   "35-39 years",             "25-49",                               "40-44",   "40-44 years",             "25-49",                               "45-49",   "45-49 years",             "25-49",                               "50-54",   "50-54 years",             "50-74",                               "55-59",   "55-59 years",             "50-74",                               "60-64",   "60-64 years",             "50-74",                               "65-69",   "65-69 years",             "50-74",                               "70-74",   "70-74 years",             "50-74",                                 "75+",     "75+ years",               "75+"                                 )                         )  # Create classifications from files  vs_file <- system.file("extdata", "Age5.vs", package = "pxmake")  agg_files <- c(   system.file("extdata", "10-years_classes.agg", package = "pxmake"),   system.file("extdata", "25-years_classes.agg", package = "pxmake") )  if (vs_file != "" & all(agg_files != "")) {   # Create classification from .vs file and use aggregations mentioned in .vs   c2 <- px_classification(vs_path = vs_file)    # Create classification from .vs file and manually specify aggregation files   c3 <- px_classification(vs_path = vs_file,                           agg_paths = agg_files                           )    identical(c2, c3) } #> [1] TRUE

title: TITLE — px_title
code: # Set TITLE for all languages x1 <-   px(population_gl) |>   px_title('Population GR')  # Print TITLE px_title(x1) #> [1] "Population GR"  # Set TITLE for individual languages library(tibble) x2 <-   x1 |>   px_languages(c('en', 'kl')) |>   px_title(tribble(~language, ~value,                       'en', 'Population GR',                       'kl', 'Innuttaasut KL')) px_title(x2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   language value          #>   <chr>    <chr>          #> 1 en       Population GR  #> 2 kl       Innuttaasut KL

title: pxmake 0.17.0
text: Remove import ‘pillar’ package. (#387) Fix various issues CONTVARIABLE. (#364 #386) px_data() updates metadata match new data frame. (#385 #396 #399) adding languages dummy values added VALUES instead blanks. Throw error using px_save() px object contains duplicates data table. (#402) Don’t save NA values aggregations files. (#401)

title: pxmake 0.16.0
text: creating px object data frame ordering cells1 determined based type data frame.

title: pxmake 0.16.0
text: Require R version >= 4.1. (#376) Store non-figures variables data table character instead factors. (#375)

title: pxmake 0.16.0
text: Make tests examples ‘fail gracefully’ URL can’t reached, comply CRAN policies. (#379)

title: pxmake 0.15.0
text: Variable order preserved appears data set. (#345) px() supports URLs input. (#353) px_save() can save px object R script , run, regenerates px object. implementation fully reliable; cases, running generated R script produces slightly different px object. (#350)

title: pxmake 0.15.0
text: Bugfix: px_micro() sometimes ordered variable references incorrectly CELLNOTES. (#348) Removed dontrun example px_classification() updating package files. (#346) Use main language VALUES CODES PX-files without CODES. (#361)

title: pxmake 0.14.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-22 Add CRAN note explaning /dontrun{} used.

title: pxmake 0.14.1
text: Fix one CRAN submission related issue, add note another.

title: pxmake 0.14.0
text: Prepare CRAN submission. (#330) Add validate = option modifying functions enable turning validation. (#332) Add functions px_classification() px_classification_save() create save classifications (value sets aggregations). (#327)

title: pxmake 0.14.0
text: px_elimination(), px_map(), px_domain() now sets value STUB/HEADING variables value character. (#325) Optimize px_micro() setting stub , instead files. Add na_to_star option px_cellnote() px_cellnotex(). (#335) Support PX-files cell values contain closing parentheses. (#337) Avoid R CMD Check notes, warning errors. Add CRAN installation instruction. Use name ‘PX-files’ consistently. Update package title description. Add @examples @return exported functions. Reduce size large files.

title: pxmake 0.12.1
text: px() px_save() can write read .parquet files. Change default value mandatory keywords descriptive rather empty string ““. done PxWin allow empty strings mandatory keywords. (#320) Improve implementation fix bugs px_cellnote() px_cellnotex(). (#289)

title: pxmake 0.12.1
text: Keyword UNITS now placed CONTVARIABLE VALUES PX-file. (#308) Add default values mandatory keywords languages. (#219) Bugfix px_language() stops removing previously defined languages. (#297) Change sorting order PX-file, variables within keywords stub/heading order instead alphabetic. (#264) Throw error value contains quotation marks (“). (#238) Allow minimal px object created even input provided. (#234) Bugfix px_micro() used undefined function. (#290) Changing figures removes previous figures variable form cells1 cells2. (#300) Add validation check CONTVARIABLE TIMEVAL STUB HEADING variables. (#305) Add pxmake logo. Keyword MAP now stored variables2 instead table2. (#295)

title: pxmake 0.12.0
text: Change argument ‘variable’ ‘variables’ ‘value’ px_stub(), px_heading(), px_figures(), px_timeval(), px_add_totals(), align modifying functions. (#296)

title: pxmake 0.12.0
text: Add modifying functions: px_values(), px_variable_label(), px_data(), px_source(). (#291) Add pkgdown version documentation : https://statisticsgreenland.github.io/pxmake/ Add example data sets population_gl greenlanders. (#282) px_micro() support multilingual keyword_values arguments. (#306) Add example section help pages.

title: pxmake 0.12.0
